heroSection.title: Ensure Complete Network Security with SecureNet
heroSection.subtitle: Analyze threats, check IP addresses, detect data leaks, and protect passwords — all in one solution

servicesSection.title: Comprehensive Cybersecurity in One Place
servicesSection.subtitle: Our tools help you prevent threats, protect sensitive data, and strengthen your network security

checkIp.title: IP Address Check
checkIp.description: Analyze IP addresses and detect threats. Quickly block malicious sources.

dataLeaks.title: Data Leak Detection
dataLeaks.description: Check if your data has been leaked. We analyze leak databases to protect your information.

passwords.title: Password Assessment
passwords.description: Check the strength of your passwords and get recommendations for improving them.

reports.title: Report Generation
reports.description: Receive detailed security reports and insights into current threats to your network.

protectionToolsSection.title: How Does SecureNet Protect Your Data?
protectionToolsSection.subtitle: Four key tools that provide complete security for your network, helping you prevent attacks, protect sensitive information, and respond quickly to threats. SecureNet offers solutions that can instantly identify potential risks and alert you to potential incidents, ensuring protection at every stage.

card1.title: IP Address Check
card1.description: Thousands of new threats emerge online every second. Our IP analysis tool allows you to instantly check if a given IP address is a source of malicious activity. We use threat databases and cyber intelligence to keep your network safe.

card2.title: Data Leak Detection
card2.description: Your clients' and company's data may be publicly exposed due to breaches on third-party services. SecureNet analyzes data leaks across millions of compromised records and alerts you if your data has been exposed.

card3.title: Password Strength Assessment
card3.description: A weak password is an open door for hackers. Our tool helps you determine how strong your password is and provides recommendations to improve it. We also check if your passwords have been leaked in data breaches.

card4.title: Security Reports
card4.description: Security requires monitoring. Our tool automatically analyzes your network and generates detailed reports on potential threats. Use these insights to protect your business or personal accounts.

threatCaseSection.title: Learn About Potential Threats and How SecureNet Solves Them
threatCaseSection.subtitle: Real cyberattack cases and security solutions to help you prevent data loss:
threatCaseSection.case: Many users reuse the same password across different websites. After a popular service was hacked, cybercriminals gained access to millions of credentials and started using them to break into other accounts.
threatCaseSection.solution: Users who checked their passwords with our service discovered that their credentials had been compromised. This allowed them to change their passwords in time and secure their accounts.
threatCaseSection.result: Thousands of users avoided account theft and financial losses.

passwordCheck.title: How strong is your password?
passwordCheck.subtitle: Your password is the first line of defense for your data. Make sure it is complex enough and has not been leaked. Enter your password below and we will assess its security.

recommendations.use_a_few_words,_avoid_common_phrases: Use a few words, avoid common phrases
recommendations.no_need_for_symbols,_digits,_or_uppercas: No need for symbols, digits, or uppercase letters
recommendations.add_another_word_or_two_uncommon_words_a: Add another word or two. Uncommon words are better.
recommendations.use_a_longer_keyboard_pattern_with_more_: Use a longer and more complex keyboard pattern with more turns.
recommendations.avoid_years_that_are_associated_with_you: Avoid years that are associated with you
recommendations.avoid_dates_and_years_that_are_associate: Avoid dates and years that are associated with you.
recommendations.capitalization_doesn_t_help_very_much: Capitalization doesn't help very much. Try using other methods to strengthen the password.
recommendations.all-uppercase_is_almost_as_easy_to_guess: All-uppercase is almost as easy to guess as all-lowercase
recommendations.predictable_substitutions_like_instead_o: Predictable substitutions like '@' instead of 'a' don't help very much

warnings.straight_rows_of_keys_are_easy_to_guess: Straight rows of keys are easy to guess. Avoid them.
warnings.short_keyboard_patterns_are_easy_to_gues: Short keyboard patterns are easy to guess. Try using longer, more random combinations.
warnings.repeats_like_aaa_are_easy_to_guess: Repeats like 'aaa' are easy to guess. Avoid them.
warnings.sequences_like_abc_or_6543_are_easy_to_g: Sequences like 'abc' or '6543' are easy to guess. Better to use random characters or more complex combinations.
warnings.repeats_like_abcabcabc_are_only_slightly: Repeats like 'abcabcabc' are only slightly harder to guess than 'abc'. Avoid such patterns.
warnings.recent_years_are_easy_to_guess: Recent years are easy to guess
warnings.dates_are_often_easy_to_guess: Dates are often easy to guess. Avoid using personal dates (such as birthdates or anniversaries).
warnings.a_word_by_itself_is_easy_to_guess: A word by itself is easy to guess. Try adding characters or numbers to complicate the password.
warnings.this_is_a_top_10_common_password: This is a top-10 common password. Using such passwords significantly lowers security. Try creating a unique and complex password.
warnings.this_is_a_top_100_common_password: This is a top-100 common password. Using such passwords significantly lowers security. Try creating a unique and complex password.
warnings.this_is_a_very_common_password: This is a very common password.
warnings.this_is_similar_to_a_commonly_used_passw: This is similar to a commonly used password
warnings.names_and_surnames_by_themselves_are_eas: Names and surnames by themselves are easy to guess
warnings.common_names_and_surnames_are_easy_to_gu: Common names and surnames are easy to guess

PasswordGenerator.title: Create a strong password
PasswordGenerator.subtitle: Your data is protected! Use the password generator to create a unique and secure password that complies with cybersecurity best practices. Customize the settings and copy the ready password with one click.
PasswordGenerator.indication: Specify the number of passwords in the settings

qaDropDown.question1: What is considered a strong password?
qaDropDown.answer1: A strong password should be long, at least 12 characters (ideally 16 or more). It should include both uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters like @, #, $, %. It’s important that the password doesn't contain easily guessable combinations, such as names, birthdates, or common phrases like '123456' or 'password'. These passwords are easy to crack.
qaDropDown.question2: Is it okay to use the same password for all accounts?
qaDropDown.answer2: Using the same password for all accounts is a huge security risk. If one account is compromised, an attacker can easily access your other accounts as well. To protect your data, it’s important to use unique passwords for each service, and consider using a password manager to securely store and manage them.
qaDropDown.question3: How can I remember all my passwords?
qaDropDown.answer3: The best way to remember all your passwords is to use password managers like Bitwarden, 1Password, or KeePass. These tools help securely store and generate strong passwords for each service. If you prefer to write passwords down manually, make sure to protect them with a password or store them in encrypted files. It's not recommended to keep passwords in unprotected notes or documents.
qaDropDown.question4: How often should I change my password?
qaDropDown.answer4: If your password is long, complex, and unique, you don’t need to change it unless there has been a data breach or suspicious activity. However, if the service recommends a password change or if you’re notified of a potential data breach, you should change it immediately. Regularly updating your passwords helps increase your security.

vulnerabilitiesPage.title: Find out how vulnerable your data is!
vulnerabilitiesPage.subtitle: Your emails, passwords, and links may be at risk. Use the tools below to check them for leaks and hidden risks.

leakChecker.title: Checking for data leaks
leakChecker.text: Enter your email or password to see if they were included in known leaks. We use HIBP to find traces of your data in compromised databases. This will help you change your passwords in time and protect your accounts.

leak.title: Your data was found in leaks!
leak.description: This means that your email was compromised as a result of a data leak. Attackers can use this information to hack your accounts.
leak.recommendation1: Urgently change your password on all services where it was used.
leak.recommendation3: Do not reuse this email for important accounts.

noLeak.title: Your data was not found in any leaks!
noLeak.description: Your email is not currently found in any known leaks. This is a good sign, but security is still important.

leak.title: Your data was found in leaks!
leak.description: This means that your password was compromised in a data leak. Attackers can use it to hack your accounts.
leak.recommendation1: Urgently change your password on all services where it was used.

noLeak.title: Your data was not found in any leaks!
noLeak.description: Your password is not currently found in any known leaks. This is a good sign, but security is still important.

shortLinkDecoder.title: Deploying Short Links
shortLinkDecoder.text: Enter a shortened URL (like bit.ly) to see where it leads. Short links can hide phishing or malicious sites. Find out the full address and protect yourself from hidden threats.
shortLinkDecoder.resultAdvice: Find out if this site is safe! Go to the 'Analysis' section to check.
